intro: Prenanthella, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Prenanthella species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are valued for their ornamental appeal in gardens.
